group.description:
Brothers and Sisters in Christ, I‚Äôm @Shooglenifty. God is good and His mercy endures forever!
***By posting you are agreeing to our posting standards. We will remove a post according to our interpretation (written by us) of the guidelines below. If there is any confusion, please DM.
***My hopes for the group is to foster phileo between the Christian diaspora that has chosen to join this group. We want to be a place where unbelievers come for answers and believers come to be bolstered in their faith. By the grace of God through the blood of Jesus we will bring His love to multitudes. My reasoning? I believe this: "Never doubt God‚Äôs mighty power to work in you and accomplish all this. He will achieve infinitely more than your greatest request, your most unbelievable dream, and exceed your wildest imagination! He will outdo them all, for his miraculous power constantly energizes you.‚Äù Ephesians 3:20 TPT

***PLEASE READ BEFORE POSTING: Posts that are encouraged (think ENGAGEMENT! and WHAT IS GOD TELLING YOU!):

1. Testimonies, praise reports, prayer requests, encouragements, prophecies, words from God, exhortations, etc.

2. Questions of those looking to our community for answers that only God can give.

3. Sermons, articles, videos, pictures and verses as long as they have a good description outlining who, what, where, why and how. If you don't respect the link you are posting or the other Christians in the group enough to take some time with your post, please don't post it. 

***It seems most just post and run (seagull posting) and this is not God's heart nor mine. This group has ONE timeline. It also has many members. Is it respectful on your part to post several one-line posts in a row pushing someone else's well-thought post or plea out of sight of the group? 

With that in mind the following types of posts will be removed at the sole discretion of the moderators:
1. Off-topic posts: politics, flat earth, begging for followers or money (please reach out to the admin if you believe you have a worthy fundraising cause. You will be required to provide proof and cause. Any fundraiser posted without prior discussion will be removed), promoting personal agendas, etc.

2. Intentionally divisive, argumentative, disrespectful or racist posts.

3. Low effort (Just posting a video/link is not sufficient within the group, you must also write YOUR OWN description of the link/video; the included video/link description is not acceptable) or multiple posts in a row (limit of 2 posts per 3 hours)

4. Posts that don't meet the criteria mentioned above

5. Any reposts from other groups that are unrelated to Christianity; reposts of posts already in the group timeline (if you agree with a post just say it in the original post); and any reposts of your disagreements within a post brought to the group timeline.

6. Anyone who spams the same post to multiple groups (yes, I check timelines), or continually posts the same post/s in the timeline. 

7. All members who block the administrators and moderators will be removed.

***Remember that we are the body of Christ. Please keep your posts in line with Philippians 4:8 (ESV): Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence, if there is anything worthy of praise, think (post!) about these things.

***‚ÄúThe Lord bless you and keep you; the Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace. ‚ÄúSo shall they put my name upon the people of Israel, and I will bless them.‚Äù Numbers 6:24-27 ESV

***Group Creator:  @Micaiah
Admins/Mods: @Shooglenifty, @riustan

_source.content: In 2012, the Securities and Exchange Commission charged Pfizer Inc. with violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) when its subsidiaries bribed doctors and other health care professionals employed by foreign governments in Bulgaria, China, Croatia, Czech Republic, Italy, Kazakhstan, Russia, and Serbia to win business. According to the SEC, employees of Pfizer‚Äôs subsidiaries authorised and made cash payments and provided other incentives to bribe government doctors to utilise Pfizer products.In 2012, Pfizer had paid $1.2 billion to settle claims by nearly 10,000 women that its hormone replacement therapy drug, Prempro, caused breast cancer. The Prempro settlements come after six years of trials, in which several plaintiffs were awarded tens of millions of dollars, including punitive damages for the drug maker‚Äôs actions in withholding information about the risk of breast cancer from Prempro.In 2013, Pfizer agreed to pay $55 million to settle criminal charges of failing to warn patients and doctors about the risks of kidney disease, kidney injury, kidney failure, and acute interstitial nephritis caused by its proton pump inhibitor, Protonix.In 2013, Pfizer set aside $288 million to settle claims by 2,700 people that its drug, Chantix, caused suicidal thoughts and severe psychological disorders. The FDA determined that Chantix is probably associated with a higher risk of a heart attack.In 2014, Pfizer paid $35 million to settle a lawsuit accusing its subsidiary of promoting the kidney transplant drug, Rapamune, for unapproved uses, including bribing doctors to prescribe it to patients. According to New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman, who led the probe, Wyeth got doctors to push the drug for unapproved uses, relying on ‚Äúmisleading presentations of data.‚ÄùIn 2016, Pfizer was fined a record ¬£84.2 million for overcharging the NHS for its anti-epilepsy drug, Phenytoin, by 2,600 per cent (from ¬£2.83 to ¬£67.50 a capsule), increasing the cost to UK taxpayers from ¬£2 million in 2012 to about ¬£50 million in 2013.This is only a partial list of the fraud, corruption, and criminality of Pfizer. There are other examples of Pfizer unethically testing pharmaceutical products in the world‚Äôs poorest nations and participating in other criminal actions.
_source.contentraw:
In 2012, the Securities and Exchange Commission charged Pfizer Inc. with violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) when its subsidiaries
bribed doctors and other health care professionals employed by foreign governments in Bulgaria, China, Croatia, Czech Republic, Italy, Kazakhstan,
Russia, and Serbia to win business. According to the SEC, employees of Pfizer‚Äôs subsidiaries authorised and made cash payments and provided other
incentives to bribe government doctors to utilise Pfizer products.
In 2012, Pfizer had paid $1.2 billion to settle claims by nearly 10,000 women that its hormone replacement therapy drug, Prempro, caused breast
cancer. The Prempro settlements come after six years of trials, in which several plaintiffs were awarded tens of millions of dollars, including
punitive damages for the drug maker‚Äôs actions in withholding information about the risk of breast cancer from Prempro.
In 2013, Pfizer agreed to pay $55 million to settle criminal charges of failing to warn patients and doctors about the risks of kidney disease,
kidney injury, kidney failure, and acute interstitial nephritis caused by its proton pump inhibitor, Protonix.
In 2013, Pfizer set aside $288 million to settle claims by 2,700 people that its drug, Chantix, caused suicidal thoughts and severe psychological
disorders. The FDA determined that Chantix is probably associated with a higher risk of a heart attack.
In 2014, Pfizer paid $35 million to settle a lawsuit accusing its subsidiary of promoting the kidney transplant drug, Rapamune, for unapproved uses,
including bribing doctors to prescribe it to patients. According to New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman, who led the probe, Wyeth got
doctors to push the drug for unapproved uses, relying on ‚Äúmisleading presentations of data.‚Äù
In 2016, Pfizer was fined a record ¬£84.2 million for overcharging the NHS for its anti-epilepsy drug, Phenytoin, by 2,600 per cent (from ¬£2.83 to
¬£67.50 a capsule), increasing the cost to UK taxpayers from ¬£2 million in 2012 to about ¬£50 million in 2013.
This is only a partial list of the fraud, corruption, and criminality of Pfizer. There are other examples of Pfizer unethically testing
pharmaceutical products in the world‚Äôs poorest nations and participating in other criminal actions.

card.title: White House Pushed Facebook to Censor Tucker Carlson on COVID-19 Vaccines: AG Landry

_source.content: The White House pressured Facebook to take action against Fox News host Tucker Carlson for supposedly saying COVID-19 vaccines ‚Äúdon‚Äôt work,‚Äù according to a document released by Louisiana‚Äôs Republican Attorney General Jeff Landry, who characterized the move as a request to censor the journalist.Landry shared the document‚Äîan email exchange between White House Director of Digital Strategy Rob Flaherty and an unidentified Facebook employee‚Äîin a Jan. 7 post on Twitter, with the comment: ‚ÄúRob Flaherty tells facebook to censor‚Äù Tucker Carlson.‚ÄúSince we‚Äôve been on the phone‚Äîthe top post about vaccines today is [T]ucker Carlson saying they don‚Äôt work. Yesterday it was Tomi Lehren [sic] saying she won‚Äôt take one,‚Äù Flaherty reportedly said in the message to the Facebook staffer, whose name and email address have been redacted.‚ÄúThis is exactly why I want to know what ‚ÄòReduction‚Äô actually looks like‚Äîif ‚Äòreduction‚Äô means ‚Äòpumping our most vaccine hesitant audience with [T]ucker Carlson saying it doesn‚Äôt work‚Äô then ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs reduction!‚Äù Flaherty continued, per the document shared by Landry.Signaling action regarding the request, the unidentified Facebook employee then reportedly wrote: ‚ÄúRunning this down now.‚ÄùThe Epoch Times has reached out with a request for comment to Facebook parent Meta, Fox News Channel, and the White House, but no reply was received by publication.‚ÄòHard Evidence‚Äô of Government Collusion With Big TechLandry, together with Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt, sued the Biden administration in May 2022 for allegedly pressuring and colluding with social media giants to suppress free speech.Schmitt on Jan. 5 was sworn in as a U.S. senator and has been replaced in his role as Missouri attorney general by Andrew Bailey.Bailey took to Twitter on Jan. 7 to say that when he took the oath of office, he swore he would protect the Constitution and explained ‚Äúwhy.‚Äù‚ÄúWe now have hard evidence that President Biden‚Äôs Administration colluded with social media companies to censor differing viewpoints and silence ‚Äòmisinformation‚Äô that was later deemed true,‚Äù Bailey wrote in a series of posts.Bailey shared a screenshot of an email from White House COVID-19 Digital Director Clarke E. Humphrey to an unidentified Twitter employee with the subject line ‚ÄúFlagging Hank Aaron misinfo‚Äù and requesting the Twitter staff to ‚Äúget moving on the process for having it removed ASAP.‚ÄùIn her request, Humphrey provided a link to a Twitter post by Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a known critic of the Biden administration‚Äôs narrative on COVID-19 vaccines.The offending tweet links to an article on the website of the Children‚Äôs Health Defense, an activist group chaired by Kennedy Jr. that left-leaning Wikipedia labels as ‚Äúone of the main sources of misinformation on vaccines.‚ÄùThe article, from Jan. 22, 2021, says Aaron died 18 days after receiving a COVID-19 vaccine of an ‚Äúundisclosed cause‚Äù and cites Kennedy Jr. as saying that his ‚Äútragic death is part of a wave of suspicious deaths among elderly closely following administration of COVID vaccines.‚ÄùAbout a week later, the Fulton County Medical Examiner released Aaron‚Äôs cause of death as ‚Äúnatural causes‚Äù and that he didn‚Äôt have any COVID-19 symptoms, with his medical history listing prostate issues and hypertension.Besides requesting action on Kennedy Jr.‚Äôs tweet, Humphrey also added a request to ‚Äúkeep an eye out for tweets that fall in this same genre,‚Äù per the screenshot shared by Bailey.The Epoch Times has reached out to Twitter with a request for comment.‚ÄòThe Truth No Longer Matters to the White House‚ÄôBailey also shared screenshots of several other messages that he said show collusion between Big Tech and the government to suppress free speech, including another message from Flaherty to an unidentified Facebook employee in which the White House official demands ‚Äúassurances‚Äù that the social media company is taking actions ‚Äúto ensure you‚Äôre not making our country‚Äôs vaccine hesitancy problem worse.‚Äù‚ÄúThe truth no longer matters to the White House,‚Äù Bailey captioned the post.‚ÄúThese emails confirm what we‚Äôve known all along,‚Äù Bailey wrote. ‚ÄúThe Biden Admin. has been colluding with social media companies to stifle opposing voices.‚Äù‚ÄúI will continue to push back against this blatant attack on the 1st Amendment with every tool at my disposal,‚Äù he added.[Click on my replies or link below for rest of _source.contentraw:
The White House pressured Facebook to take action against Fox News host Tucker Carlson for supposedly saying COVID-19 vaccines ‚Äúdon‚Äôt work,‚Äù according to a document released by Louisiana‚Äôs Republican Attorney General Jeff Landry, who characterized the move as a request to censor the journalist.

Landry shared the document‚Äîan email exchange between White House Director of Digital Strategy Rob Flaherty and an unidentified Facebook employee‚Äîin a Jan. 7 post on Twitter, with the comment: ‚ÄúRob Flaherty tells facebook to censor‚Äù Tucker Carlson.

‚ÄúSince we‚Äôve been on the phone‚Äîthe top post about vaccines today is [T]ucker Carlson saying they don‚Äôt work. Yesterday it was Tomi Lehren [sic] saying she won‚Äôt take one,‚Äù Flaherty reportedly said in the message to the Facebook staffer, whose name and email address have been redacted.

‚ÄúThis is exactly why I want to know what ‚ÄòReduction‚Äô actually looks like‚Äîif ‚Äòreduction‚Äô means ‚Äòpumping our most vaccine hesitant audience with [T]ucker Carlson saying it doesn‚Äôt work‚Äô then ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs reduction!‚Äù Flaherty continued, per the document shared by Landry.

Signaling action regarding the request, the unidentified Facebook employee then reportedly wrote: ‚ÄúRunning this down now.‚Äù

The Epoch Times has reached out with a request for comment to Facebook parent Meta, Fox News Channel, and the White House, but no reply was received by publication.

‚ÄòHard Evidence‚Äô of Government Collusion With Big Tech

Landry, together with Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt, sued the Biden administration in May 2022 for allegedly pressuring and colluding with social media giants to suppress free speech.

Schmitt on Jan. 5 was sworn in as a U.S. senator and has been replaced in his role as Missouri attorney general by Andrew Bailey.

Bailey took to Twitter on Jan. 7 to say that when he took the oath of office, he swore he would protect the Constitution and explained ‚Äúwhy.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe now have hard evidence that President Biden‚Äôs Administration colluded with social media companies to censor differing viewpoints and silence ‚Äòmisinformation‚Äô that was later deemed true,‚Äù Bailey wrote in a series of posts.

Bailey shared a screenshot of an email from White House COVID-19 Digital Director Clarke E. Humphrey to an unidentified Twitter employee with the subject line ‚ÄúFlagging Hank Aaron misinfo‚Äù and requesting the Twitter staff to ‚Äúget moving on the process for having it removed ASAP.‚Äù

In her request, Humphrey provided a link to a Twitter post by Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a known critic of the Biden administration‚Äôs narrative on COVID-19 vaccines.

The offending tweet links to an article on the website of the Children‚Äôs Health Defense, an activist group chaired by Kennedy Jr. that left-leaning Wikipedia labels as ‚Äúone of the main sources of misinformation on vaccines.‚Äù

The article, from Jan. 22, 2021, says Aaron died 18 days after receiving a COVID-19 vaccine of an ‚Äúundisclosed cause‚Äù and cites Kennedy Jr. as saying that his ‚Äútragic death is part of a wave of suspicious deaths among elderly closely following administration of COVID vaccines.‚Äù

About a week later, the Fulton County Medical Examiner released Aaron‚Äôs cause of death as ‚Äúnatural causes‚Äù and that he didn‚Äôt have any COVID-19 symptoms, with his medical history listing prostate issues and hypertension.

Besides requesting action on Kennedy Jr.‚Äôs tweet, Humphrey also added a request to ‚Äúkeep an eye out for tweets that fall in this same genre,‚Äù per the screenshot shared by Bailey.

The Epoch Times has reached out to Twitter with a request for comment.

‚ÄòThe Truth No Longer Matters to the White House‚Äô

Bailey also shared screenshots of several other messages that he said show collusion between Big Tech and the government to suppress free speech, including another message from Flaherty to an unidentified Facebook employee in which the White House official demands ‚Äúassurances‚Äù that the social media company is taking actions ‚Äúto ensure you‚Äôre not making our country‚Äôs vaccine hesitancy problem worse.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe truth no longer matters to the White House,‚Äù Bailey captioned the post.

‚ÄúThese emails confirm what we‚Äôve known all along,‚Äù Bailey wrote. ‚ÄúThe Biden Admin. has been colluding with social media companies to stifle opposing voices.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will continue to push back against this blatant attack on the 1st Amendment with every tool at my disposal,‚Äù he added.
